laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver parenchyma is diffusely echogenic and coarsened in echotexture suggesting fatty infiltration. The liver surface contour is smooth. No focal hepatic mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. No ascites. No intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CBD measures 4 mm. The gallbladder is distended and contains layering sludge. There is a non-mobile echogenic shadowing gallstone in the cystic duct. A positive sonographic ___ sign was elicited on exam. No pericholecystic fluid or gallbladder wall thickening. The pancreas appears within normal limits, without masses or pancreatic ductal dilation. The spleen measures 9.8 cm and is normal in echogenicity and size. No hydronephrosis in the incompletely visualized kidneys. Visualized portions of the abdominal aorta and IVC are within normal limits.
